title: 1969 Chevrolet Corvette C3 Stingray 1969 Chrome Bumpers

description: Chevrolet Corvette C3 Stingray 1969 chrome bumpers

This is a 1969 Chevrolet Corvette C3 Stingray. Original delivery of this C3 was with the popular round taillights and chrome bumpers at the front and back. The car drives, stops, shifts gear and is in neat condition. The car also has the original side pipes with new chrome covers, the 350 CUI, V8 engine and the manual gearbox. The Corvette has American title and import documents.

This 1969 Chevrolet Corvette convertible
(white soft top) is finished in Fathom green over a saddle vinyl interior and equipped with a 350ci LT1 engine with a close-ratio Muncie 4-speed manual transmission.
History:

Third owner (1973).  Clean title.  No Accidents.  Original glass.  Garaged since 1984. Over the past 34 years, estimate mileage driven as 3,000 miles.  No sun.  No rain.  No taxes.  Estimate mileage on engine as 50,000 and on the car as 105,000.
1973: new hood, new wheels, speed shop built engine – LT1.
1979: new wheels, windshield, and soft top.
1983, in paint shop for 10 months: strip down, glass repair, prep, and paint.  New hood.  Chrome re-plated.
2016: Restoration at Tony's Corvette Shop, Gaithersburg, MD.  See appraisal below.
How's it drive:
Great!  Has the power.  Has the handling/cornering.  Side pipes add some excitement and growl.  Pleasure to drive.  “It's a blast” (Tony)

The LT1 has solid lifters, high-lift camshaft, 11:1 compression ratio, forged steel crankshaft, 4-bolt main block, impact extruded pistons, chrom-moly rings, low restriction exhaust, aluminum high-rise intake manifold, 4-barrel double-pump 650 cfm Holly carburetor, wide flange oil pump, and finned aluminum valve covers.
Fifteen inch wheels with new tires.  3.36 posi-traction differential.
Tony's Corvette Shop, Gaithersburg, MD,   appraisal:
EXTERIOR: Paint is in good condition; correct gloss and finish.  Body seams and fit – very good.  Chrome is in good condition.  Stainless steel trim – good condition.

ENGINE COMPARTMENT: 350/350, LT-1, 11:1 ratio.  Modified.  Block, intake, exhaust manifolds, valve covers, alternator, fan, fan clutch, master cylinder, carburetor, and water pump – replacement and in good condition.  Clutch and 4 speed tran – rebuilt.  Radiator and hoses, wire harnesses, ignition and plug wires – reproduction and in excellent condition.
INTERIOR: Saddle vinyl and in good condition.  Seat covers, carpet, sill plates, brake console, door panel are original in fair condition.  All gauges and radio are original and in good condition.

CHASSIS: Frame in excellent condition, suspension components rebuilt to factory spec, birdcage is rust free and in excellent condition.  New brake system (4) and rear e-brake.  New suspension, shocks, and leaf spring.  Steering system - rebuilt.  New tires – 5.
Contact:               Jim at 302-258-7047;   9 am to 8pm eastern
Car is located in Germantown, MD
Price:                    $24,500   OBO

1968 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe - Nicely optioned and original mathcing 's car. Recent frame-off restoration only 537 miles ago. Original 327 V8 engine and 4spd transmission run and drive very strong. Drive this car anywhere, just as the previous owner did. Factory options include power steering, power windows, leather seats, tinted glass, headrests, luggage rack, white-stripe radial tires and AM/FM stereo. Exterior has had a color change from the factory coded Silverstone Silver but there is no telling. Very nice body with great lines and gaps all around. A correct-era big block hood was added to the car during the restoration process and looks great. Interior is correct and excellent with everything working as it should. Chrome bumper Corvettes of this era are on the rise and only going up in value so drive this one home today and add (or start) your collection.

Highly sought after matching numbers 1968 Corvette L-68 coupe, powered by powerful, factory 427 motor with 400HP. Also equiipped with factory tri-carbs (rebuilt) Finished in British Green exterior paint with Saddle Vinyl interior. Odometer shows 49,000 miles. Original radio.  Intake manifold and the block match to the late model (August '68). The Saddle interior was a '69 interior color, but could be ordered on late '68 models like this one. The motor block numbers match a 435HP, but this was done as a late build.

title: 1964 Chevrolet Corvette One Owner , Number's Match , Documentation

description: This 1964 Corvette roadster was acquired from the original owner who bought it new in 1964.

Just out of three year storage this C-2 Convertible has just been in our service department for inspection and clean up. This rare find has a number's matching 327/300 hp engine that has been untouched according to the previous owner. Number's matching Muncie 4 speed transmission with a 3.36:1 axle ratio. Factory Satin Silver , with only one single repaint in the late 90's. The interior is completely original and is showing it's age. Black convertible soft top has been replaced also back in the late 90's. The Corvette has a beautiful no hit body with proper alignment to all the car's exterior body panels. The undercarriage and frame is in very good condition. Our Service department has done a four wheel brake service , Lube , Oil & filter , new wiper switch , wiper blades , rear e-brake cables , tune up & some other misc servicing items. This is a very nice driver quality C-2 Roadster .
We have the Owner's First registration and the latest one for documentation.
If you have been looking for affordable C-2 Convertible you'll want to take a closer look at this one owner car. Considered a very attractive color combo.
Easy Terms financing available with service after the sale.
Door to door enclosed transport available.

The C-3 was produced from 1968 through 1983. They were patterned after the Mako Shark by designer Larry Shinoda, although the chassis was carried over from the previous model. The body was completely redesigned with some new features that were standard and some that were options.

In 1969 the small block engine displacement increased from 327 Cubic inches to 350, though the output stayed the same. All other engine and transmission choices remained unchanged from the previous year.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this 1969 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray Convertible for your consideration.  It is powered by its 350 v8 paired to a 4 speed manual transmission.  The current owner has owned it for 31 years and it was acquired in Pennsylvania.  The Corvette was professionally repainted in 1995 at Robert's Corvette in Kalamazoo.  The car also comes with a stack of receipts of routine service work that was done to it over the years.  The power steering and brakes were recently serviced at Robert's Corvette as well.  The car rides on white letter tires mounted on factory steel wheels with hubcaps and beauty rings.  The side pipes accent the car well and demand attention.   The 350 was given aluminum valve covers and a chrome air cleaner.  This Corvette is in excellent condition both cosmetically and mechanically and is ready for its new owner.

1968 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible
Why This Car Is Special

1968 is the first year for the very popular C3 platform that ran through 1982.   Some of the most iconic Corvettes of all time are C3s.  The 427 cars, the 1978 Pace Car and Silver Anniversary and more.
Mechanical

The numbers matching 327 CID V8, 300 horsepower engine rests under the hood with an HEI ignition and a great sounding dual exhaust system. The transmission is a stout Turbo 400 automatic shifted from the center console. Power steering and power disc brakes help this Vette steer and stop like a sports car should.  Power windows are a nice feature and they also work well. These Corvettes are smooth riding and put the power to the ground with an inverse leaf spring independent rear suspension. The 68 model has vacuum operated flip up headlights and a vacuum operated windshield wiper cowl.
Interior

A nice custom touch, the Corvette emblem has been added to the backs of the seats in this convertible. A black soft top can be put up in place of the removeable hard top, or drop the top and cruise with the windows down.  A new radio powers a set of speakers in a box behind the seats for a great sound to your favorite songs.  Plenty of gauges are present above the steering wheel and in the center console to monitor every aspect of the engine, and indicator lights let you know if your tail lamps are lit.  Storage behind the seats is easily accessed and is surprisingly roomy.
Exterior

Beautiful Red paint really pops against the chrome accents and rally wheels. The removeable hardtop is painted to match and is in great shape. Rally wheels with new radial tires provide a classic and clean look.  Too much red? Put up the soft top to break it up with some black.  The curves on C3 Corvettes are very feminine and voluptuous.  It's no wonder guys can't stop staring at a 68 Corvette!  The working flip up headlights add to the sports car appeal and the dual chrome exhaust tips exiting the rear look and sound great.  Less than half of all Corvette convertible received an auxiliary hardtop in 1968 and a lot of those have lost their soft tops through the years. This is a very cool find with both tops.
Conclusion

If you're looking for a fun, reasonably priced chrome bumper C3 Corvette convertible, take a close look at this beauty.  The twin tops make it desirable and more collectible as time goes by.  It wears the perfect color combination for a Corvette, which also helps hold that value should you ever decide to sell in the future.
